@description.name: @description
@description.body: Basically a text fields which allows a selection from a list of preconfigured options. Allows custom user input. Public API is value oriented. To work with selections without custom input the ideal candidates are the {@link SelectBox} or the {@link RadioGroup}.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: textfield {qx.ui.form.TextField} textfield component of the combobox

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: button {qx.ui.form.Button} button to open the list popup
@childControl.description: button to open the list popup

@description.name: @description
@description.body: String value which will be shown as a hint if the field is all of: unset, unfocused and enabled. Set to null to not show a placeholder text.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is valid. If a widget is invalid, an invalid state will be set.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Flag signaling if a widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Message which is shown in an invalid tooltip if the {@link #required} is set to true.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whenever the value is changed this event is fired Event data: The new text value of the field.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the enabled state was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the valid state was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the invalidMessage was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fired when the required was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Toggles the popup's visibility.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Pointer} Pointer tap event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply pre-selected item

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Reacts on value changes of the text field and syncs the value to the combobox.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {qx.event.type.Data} Change event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current selection. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the current selection length. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the selection to the given start and end (zero-based). If no end value is given the selection will extend to the end of the textfield's content. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: start {Integer} start of the selection (zero-based)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: end {Integer} end of the selection

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears the current selection. This method only works if the widget is already created and added to the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Selects the whole content

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clear any text selection, then select all text

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Set the enabled state of the widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: enabled {Boolean} The enabled state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the current set enabled state.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the required state of a widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: required {Boolean} A flag signaling if the widget is required.
@param.description: A flag signaling if the widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Return the current required state of the widget.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} True, if the widget is required.
@return.description: True, if the widget is required.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the valid state of the widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: valid {Boolean} The valid state of the widget.
@param.description: The valid state of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the valid state of the widget.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} If the state of the widget is valid.
@return.description: If the state of the widget is valid.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the invalid message of the widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String} The invalid message.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the invalid message of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the invalid message if required of the widget.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: message {String} The invalid message.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the invalid message if required of the widget.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Forward the call with the given function name to the children container

@param.name: @param
@param.body: functionName {String} name of the method to forward
@param.description: name of the method to forward

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a1 {var?} first argument of the method to call
@param.description: first argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a2 {var?} second argument of the method to call
@param.description: second argument of the method to call

@param.name: @param
@param.body: a3 {var?} third argument of the method to call
@param.description: third argument of the method to call

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} The return value of the forward method
@return.description: The return value of the forward method

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the children list

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{qx.ui.core.LayoutItem[]} The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)
@return.description:
The children array (Arrays are
   reference types, please do not modify them in-place)

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the widget contains children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Returns true when the widget has children.
@return.description: Returns true when the widget has children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a new child widget. The supported keys of the layout options map depend on the layout manager used to position the widget. The options are documented in the class documentation of each layout manager {@link qx.ui.layout}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to add.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the given child item.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to remove

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove all children.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Array} An array containing the removed children.
@return.description: An array containing the removed children.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index position of the given item if it is a child item. Otherwise it returns -1. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} the item to query for

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.
@return.description: The index position or -1 when the given item is no child of this layout.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add a child at the specified index This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index, at which the item will be inserted
@param.description: Index, at which the item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item before another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: before {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item before the new item will be inserted.
@param.description: item before the new item will be inserted.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Add an item after another already inserted item This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: child {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item to add

@param.name: @param
@param.body: after {qx.ui.core.LayoutItem} item, after which the new item will be inserted
@param.description: item, after which the new item will be inserted

@param.name: @param
@param.body: options {Map?null} Optional layout data for item.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Remove the item at the specified index. This method works on the widget's children list. Some layout managers (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.HBox}) use the children order as additional layout information. Other layout manager (e.g. {@link qx.ui.layout.Grid}) ignore the children order for the layout process.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {Integer} Index of the item to remove.
@param.description: Index of the item to remove.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Locale change event handler

@param.name: @param
@param.body: e {Event} the change event

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property valid. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #valid}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property valid. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #valid}.
